job.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer, Computational Music
job.description: ltbrgtltstronggtSummaryltbrgtltstronggt ltbrgtApples Computational Music team is looking for a hardworking Software Engineer to advance technologies around music understanding and analysis We perform both exploratory and targeted algorithms research and development in a dynamic small team environment Our projects involve significant application of Machine Learning and audio music and signalprocessing with an explicit goal of shipping software to support current and future products and features at the scale of Apples ecosystemltbrgtltbrgt ltbrgtltstronggtKey Qualificationsltbrgtltstronggt ltbrgtA strong history of delivering high quality results on timeltbrgtltbrgtProven ability to work collaboratively within in a multifunctional environmentltbrgtltbrgtProficient in PythonltbrgtltbrgtExperience with any of C Objective C or SwiftltbrgtltbrgtDeployment of machine learning models to productionltbrgtltbrgtComfort working in taking ownership of and improving existing software projectsltbrgtltbrgtInterest in working on music projectsltbrgtltbrgtAt least 3 years of fulltime experience in software engineeringltbrgtltbrgt1 year or more experience of shipping production Machine Learning modelsltbrgtltbrgt ltbrgtltstronggtDescriptionltbrgtltstronggt ltbrgtThe Computation Music team is looking for a Software Engineer with a strong track record of building and shipping significant software products who is selfmotivated and passionate about their work The ideal candidate will be a strong Python and C or Objective C or Swift programmer with validated experience of crafting prototyping and delivering algorithmic solutions via complete performant implementations ltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtYou will play a key role in addressing the last mile challenges of deploying ML models for music into production and providing feedback to other parts of the ML lifecycleltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtThe person in this role should be interested in staying up to date on new developments in the field and be able to apply that knowledge to solving challenging problems across multiple domainsltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtWe would love to see examples of prior work you are proud of Feel free to point us at your GitHub repository or equivalent if you have oneltbrgtltbrgt ltbrgtRole Number 200273408ltbrgtltbrgt
